Articles.Content:
So recently I was struck with a revelation on rocket design, I immediately started up KSP and made this rocket... the Luna 1... definitely the coolest I've made yet. It contains a compact rover and a monopropellant-based lander, which I had never tried before.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/SJWh7)

needless to say, it was a huge success, the only real problem was when I realized that I had remoteTech installed and had neglected to put up communication satellites. I was connected to mission control through a failed science vessel throughout the flight. thoughts?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-01T04:37:14Z" title="07/01/2015 04:37  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 1, 2015</time> by Itsjustrocketscience**
Hehehe, that's a nicely Kerbal over-the-top method of rover delivery ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).
